variable.name: shareid
variable.description: Unique study participant identification number

variable.comment: IDTYPE and ID taken together form the study participant's ID number.

variable.description: Medical History - Cerebrovascular, Neurological and Venous Diseases - Cerebrovascular Disease First Opinions: Duration - Days
variable.comment: H174-H180 are related variables. See annotated form for relationship between related variables. H177, H178, and H179 form the duration of the TIA or stroke episode. Format used is days/hours/minutes. To calculate total duration time need to convert to all the same units then add together.

variable.name: h711
variable.description: Sociodemographic Questions - Part II - Self-administered: Using the occupation coding sheet choose the code that best describes your occupation.
variable.comment: Some of the original occupation codes have been combined into occupation groups to preserve confidentiality. The original occupation codes are available upon request. Occupation group 1 includes MD, dentist, lawyer, judge, scientist, research, engineer and computer science. Occupation group 2 includes psychologist, social worker, mental health counselor, banker, accountant and administrative (e.g. personnel). Occupation group 3 includes nurse, medical personnel, physical, occupation, speech therapist, police, fire, security, military and clergy (minister, priest, rabbi). Occupation group 4 includes sales, marketing, insurance, realtor, writer, editor, artist, graphic designer, craftsperson and musician. Occupation group 5 includes manager, consultant (e.g. production manager), laboratory technician, mechanic, skilled labor (e.g. plumber, carpenter, painter, hairdresser), sports pro, coach and exercise instructor. Occupation group 6 includes secretary, clerk, data entry, retail, cashier, factory, assembly, general labor (e.g. custodian, delivery, mailman, truck driver) and heavy labor (e.g. construction, landscaping).
